message.source:
Access your public library’s digital catalogue directly from your %4 — any time.

All you need is a Wi Fi connection and a library card.

What’s OverDrive and how does it work?

OverDrive is a free service offered by public libraries that lets you borrow eBooks from their digital collections. Sign in with a valid library card on your %4. When you search or browse the Kobo catalogue, you’ll see the added options to borrow or place a hold on items that are also available from your public library.

How do I borrow an eBook?

Search Kobo and filter your results to show books available with OverDrive. You’ll find the options to borrow or place a hold on your book’s item details page.

What does “place a hold” mean?

Just like with print books, libraries purchase limited numbers of digital copies from book publishers, so only one person can check out an eBook at a time. By placing a hold on an item that is currently checked out, you are joining the waitlist to borrow it when it becomes available.

How do I borrow an available hold?

When a hold is available for you to borrow, you'll get a notification via email or alert on your device. You'll have three days to borrow the item before your hold lapses.

How long can I borrow an eBook for?

Lending periods vary by library and may differ for individual items. For specific information on your library’s lending policies, please visit their website.

How do I return an eBook I borrowed?

No need to worry about late fees! Items you’ve borrowed are automatically returned at the end of their lending period. We’ll save any bookmarks or annotations you’ve made, so if you’d like to continue reading an expired item, you can purchase a copy or borrow it again to pick up where you left off.

Can I renew eBooks?

Once an item is expired you can borrow it again. You may have to wait to borrow the item again if other readers have placed a hold on it.

Can I use OverDrive on other devices?

You can borrow and read library books from a variety of other devices by downloading the Libby app.

What if I’ve forgotten my card number or PIN?

If you can’t remember your card number or PIN, or you’re having trouble signing in, please contact your library directly for support.
